text:
Good morning, I hope you are doing well.
Recently I have been confirmed by HubSpot that for a new incoming email that we automatically associate with the contact and company record from the sender, HS associate this email with the last 5 deals where the same sender is associated and this is hampering the work from our sales team. This functionality is native from HubSpot but I was wondering if there could be any workaround via API, or something to not associate this emails or delete this association via API. Any suggestion idea?

Hey everyone :raised_hands:
I can't access files in my test app account. In the menu Marketing, Files doesn't exist for me anymore. Instead, there is only Design Tools. I guess with all those new updates Files are moved elsewhere.

Can anyone help me find Files after this change?

Thanks :pray:
You’d have to look into service workers, and probably use the form submission api, it would only upload the data if the user revisited the page when they went online

I still see Files in the Marketing menu, but this is the URL for files so you can try to reach it directly:

<https://app.HubSpot.com/files/111111>

Replace the numbers at the end with your portal ID - if your permissions changed you should get a specific error page, hopefully this helps narrow down what happened!
Is there a way I can create a list of all the landing pages including their page title, meta description and url

Wow! That's worked! Thank you <@U03AKL6Q1B2>
You saved my day :pray:

Still curious where they've gone from the menu
You're welcome! Happy this worked, and it is very strange that it's missing from the menu - are you in any betas for that account?

Hey everyone,
When I am trying to generate the access token it's giving me error
the error is:-Couldn’t complete the connection
This account doesn't have access to some HubSpot features that are required by this app. Please contact the app developer.
Please help me if someone knows how can I resolve this issue.TIA
just to double check when you say email you mean the literal engagement object Email right? not a contact
I think so. I mean the emails registered under the emails tab in the deal.
It seems that those are automatically associated to the last 5 recent deals where the contact is associated
Interesting, I've never seen that before you could definitely solve this with a custom code but I want to see if there's an easier way
Thanks
of course
Are you sending these email from outlook or gmail?
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Possibility-to-disable-automatic-association-to-deals/idi-p/270210>

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report.a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.
Well. The emails are sent from our customers via email
Those emails are associated automatically to the contact and company. This is ok. But additionally to deals. And this is what we don’t want
Yep emails that you send to customers would do the same thing

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Control-timeline-activity-associations-to-associated-objects/idi-p/315609/page/3#comments> another one, basically it appears in this one that HubSpot will not support editing the default associations anytime soon
The custom code way:
Yes. But this emails we send them trough gmail using the HubSpot extension where we can decide if we associate it or not. Or directly send the email inside the deal.

You can build a workflow that watches for incoming emails. when it's triggered use custom code to pull the most recent email for that particular contact. (associations api) pull the associated deals for that email. (search endpoint). If it's been associated to 5 emails remove all the associations (associations api). Docs:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
Sure. Which should be the trigger?
New email is created for a contact
All right. I will test it. Because I want that the email remain if the deal is related. Si I have to check the subject or something
Yeah it's a little bit of a tricky problem, you don't want it associated to deals but also do want it associated to deals
Yes.
Hahaha
Thanks for your support. As always
of course, glad to help

We have our website half on externally-hosted React, and half on reverse proxy HubSpot CMS theme. I know we can enable the cookie banner in the CMS, but is there any way we could add it to the React half of the site as well?
if you add the HS tracking code on the react website and the cookie banner targeting is correct it should appear
None that I'm aware of. So yes, it's weird. Hope someone on HubSpot team could clarify whether there is any changes in the work for the Files

Does anyone hav experience with the HubSpot <> Eventbrite integration with Marketing Events and the API? I am trying to access events made from eventbrite and this requires knowing the “externalEventId”. I am assuming this would be the eventbrite Id but that doesn’t seem to be the case. Anyone have experience with this or know if it’s possible to actually access these eventbrite events through the API?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/marketing-events#endpoint?spec=PATCH-/marketing/v3/marketing-events/events/%7BexternalEventId%7D>

Hi everyone, is there anyone who can vet my thought process here. The goal is to standardize Contact Geo location by reading data from a HubDB table. When a Contact is created/updated use Geo location from HubDB and standardize properties in Contact. Solution should be without Ops Hub Pro.
•  Solution A: Use Webhook Public App Subscription that posts real-time Contact Create/Update payload to a URL (middleware). Allow middleware to query HubDB and then update the Contact properties appropriately.
•  Solution B: Private App Token set up and then use Postman (or PowerAutomate) to run a "cron job" that queries Contact last created/updated in 15min interval. Use the Contacts and perform queries to HubDB API and update the Contacts (Contact API) appropriately.
Am I missing anything? Any other solution?

Honestly even easier is just have zapier be the middleware tool and remove the need to setup a webhook. Just set the trigger for new contact or updated address, and then query hubdb and then copy the info back to the contact
Thank you <@U01QVR44MEY>, yes an iPaaS tool could help here but customer has PowerAutomate and Postman in their tech stack and they are not willing to venture outside of those for costs.
totally understand, then I would suggest setting up a lambda as the middleware to handle the processing and searching
I really don't think you'll want to go down the postman route because cron jobs just aren't ever the best way to build tools like this
Correct. I will include lambda as a possible option as well.
Thanks! Still not working
<@U04G3HAKNLQ> Did you try to remove the *comma* in *background_color={{ context.background_color or "#CCC" }}*
